prereq.p: You must have the Topology_Browser_Administrator role.
To check currently assigned role(s), select the User ID on the top right hand corner and click View User Profile. The assigned role(s) are displayed.

context.p:
This tutorial describes the steps required to create a collection with a chosen custom topology. A collection in custom topology is a grouping of topology data objects or collections organized under a flexible hierarchy of user-defined collections. A user may wish to group nodes under a collection in order to sort objects by custom criteria, such as: location, relationships, or type.
Note: A custom topology is an extension of the “Collection” action functionality already existing in ENM.

step.cmd: Create collection within a custom topology

ol.li: Launch Topology Browser.
Select a custom topology from the Topology drop down.

Click required collection.
Note: If no collections exist, select the root of Custom Topology.
Click Create Collection. The Create Collection fly-out panel is displayed.
Enter required information in the fly-out panel. For more information, see Create a Collection Fly-out.
Click Create. The collection is added to the custom topology tree and automatically selected.

info.p: Note: The Add Topology Data button is available in the action bar when a collection of objects is selected.

ol.li: Select required Collection.
Click Add Topology Data. The Add Topology Data fly-out panel is displayed.

In the Add Topology Data fly-out, select the required scope using one of the following tabs:
Topology Learn More
Search Learn More
Click Add.
Select the required collection.

Click Export. For more information, see Export Collection(s) to a File tutorial.
Note: if a collections of object is selected the button is labeled Export Collection, if a collection of collections or collection of collections and objects is selected the button is labeled Export Topology.

Select required collection.
Note: You can only delete a collection of objects.
Click Delete.

Select required collection.
Note: You can only remove a collection of objects.
Click Remove from Collection.
Click Remove.

step.cmd: Set Collection Sharing Permissions from Private to Public (Optional)

ol.li: Select required collection.
Click Set to Public.
Select required collection.

Click Update Contents.
Note: If the selected Criteria returns no results, a confirmation dialog box is displayed:
Select Update Contents to update the Collection with empty contents.
Select Keep Contents to leave the Collection as it is.
If the selected Criteria results exceed the Collection limits, an error dialog box is displayed:
Click Ok to leave the Collection as it is.
If you don't have permission to modify the Collection or an unexpected result is received, an error dialog box is displayed:
Click Ok to try again.
Contact your System Administrator if this issue persists.
Select required collection.
Click Edit Criteria.
Select Search Criteria from the table to copy it that will be used to define the Collection.

Click Save.
Note: If the selected Criteria returns no results, a confirmation dialog box is displayed:
Select Update Criteria to update the Collection Search Criteria and accept that the Collection will be empty.
Select Cancel to select a different Search Criteria.
If the selected Criteria results exceed the Collection limits, an error dialog box is displayed:
Click Ok to leave the Collection as it is.
If you don't have permission to modify the Collection or an unexpected result is received, an error dialog box is displayed:
Click Ok to try again.
Contact your System Administrator if this issue persists.

result.p: The collection is successfully managed as required.
